results.title: Runway warning lights were broken at time of Japan plane crash, report says

results.title: Government Auctions Gangster Dawood Ibrahim‚Äôs 4 Properties In Maharashtra
creator: National Correspondent(Smiriti Ramana)
results.description: The fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim has properties that the government of Maharashtra is selling today in an auction. The properties are four pieces of land in Mumbake village, Ratnagiri district, Maharashtra. They are being sold for at least ‚Çπ19 lakh. This is part of the government‚Äôs action against criminals and their illegal activities under a special law from 1976. Dawood Ibrahim is well-known for his crimes, especially the 1993 Bombay blasts. These blasts were very harmful, killing over 250 people and hurting many others. Dawood is still wanted in India and is considered a global terrorist. Dawood‚Äôs Childhood Home To [‚Ä¶]
results.content: The fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim has properties that the government of Maharashtra is selling today in an auction. The properties are four pieces of land in Mumbake village, Ratnagiri district, Maharashtra. They are being sold for at least ‚Çπ19 lakh. This is part of the against criminals and their illegal activities under a special law from 1976. Dawood Ibrahim is well-known for his crimes, especially the 1993 Bombay blasts. These blasts were very harmful, killing over 250 people and hurting many others. Dawood is still wanted in India and is considered a global terrorist. Today‚Äôs auction in Mumbai includes land that belonged to Dawood‚Äôs family. One special property is his childhood home in Mumbake village. Ajay Srivastava, a lawyer, and Shiv Sena member wants to buy this home. He has tried to buy Dawood‚Äôs properties before. If he wins, he plans to build a school there. Also Read: The auction is happening between 2:00 pm and 3:30 pm. Many people have shown interest in buying these properties. People were scared to buy Dawood‚Äôs properties in the past, but now they are coming forward. The government has sold Dawood‚Äôs properties before, like in 2017 and 2020, and earned money from these sales. In the last nine years, 11 properties of David or his relatives have already been auctioned by the . There have also been recent news reports about Dawood‚Äôs health. Some say he was poisoned and taken to a hospital in Karachi, Pakistan. But, there‚Äôs no confirmation from Pakistani authorities, and Dawood‚Äôs associate says he is fine. The auction of Dawood Ibrahim‚Äôs properties is a significant step by the government to fight against crime and use the criminal‚Äôs assets for better purposes. Our prolific Staff Writer at India Observers is committed to delivering a diverse range of news, offering insights across various categories. With a dedication to accurate reporting, the Staff Writer ensures that readers receive timely and comprehensive updates on a myriad of topics. Explore the world of news through the lens of our versatile Staff Writer, bringing you the latest from every corner of the news spectrum.

results.title: MobiKwik Refiles DRHP, To Raise INR 700 Cr Via Fresh Issue
creator: Debarghya Sil
results.description: Delhi NCR-based fintech unicorn MobiKwik, in its second attempt to go public, has once again filed its draft red herring‚Ä¶
results.content: MobiKwik is raising INR 700 Cr through fresh issues of shares without any offer-for-sale component The startup intends to raise a pre-IPO placement aggregating up to INR 140 Cr In the first six months of FY24, the startup has reported a net profit of INR 9.5 Cr Delhi NCR-based fintech unicorn MobiKwik, in its second attempt to go public, has once again filed its draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with the markets regulator SEBI. The startup is raising INR 700 Cr through fresh issues of shares without any offer-for-sale component. However, the startup intends to raise a pre-IPO placement aggregating up to INR 140 Cr in consultation with book running lead managers (BRLMS). If the pre-IPO placement is completed, then the fresh issue size will be reduced accordingly. The development comes almost two days after Inc42 exclusively wrote that the startup will be refiling its draft papers and is looking to raise up to INR 880 Cr via fresh with no OFS component in the IPO offer. Existing shareholders not selling their shares during an IPO indicates the confidence that the shareholders have with promoters. Besides, the startup in the first six months of FY24 has managed to turn profitable. In the first two quarters of FY24, it has reported a net profit of INR 9.5 Cr, while its revenue from operations was INR 381 Cr, almost 70% of the revenue in the previous fiscal year. Being a fintech startup, MobiKwik intends to utilise the IPO net proceeds for funding its financial service business, payment services and investment in artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML). If we talk about the startup‚Äôs shareholding structure, founders Bipin Preet Singh and Upasana Taku combined own 32.25% stakes on a fully diluted basis. Bajaj Finance Limited is the second largest shareholder with 13.44%, followed by Peak XV Partners (formerly known as Sequoia Capital) with 13.06% stake in the company. It is pertinent to note that the startup‚Äôs current IPO offering is almost 63% lower than INR 1,900 Cr that it had looked to raise through the public bourses in 2021. Back then, the DRHP documents revealed that the IPO offer consisted of a fresh issue of up to INR 1,500 Cr and an OFS component of up to INR 400 Cr. Existing investors American Express, Bajaj Finance, Peak XV Partners, along with founders (promoters) Bipin Preet Singh and Upasana Taku, were to participate in the OFS. However, the startup despite getting SEBI‚Äôs approval shelved its IPO plans like many other Indian startups due to market conditions. However, of late, Indian startups have witnessed several companies aiming to hit the public market. From co-working space Awfis, to Bhavish Aggarwal‚Äôs Ola Electric all have filed their IPO papers for SEBI‚Äôs approval.

results.title: 'Ready to take any responsibility': YS Sharmila on joining Congress
results.description: YS Sharmila, who recently joined the Congress party, expressed her readiness to take on any responsibilities assigned by the high command, following her meeting with Congress Chief Mallikarjun Kharge. YS Sharmila's party, YSR Telangana Party, merged with the Congress, fulfilling her father's ... Reported by IndiaTimes 10 minutes ago.
results.content: Friday, 5 January 2024 ( 37 minutes ago ) YS Sharmila , who recently joined the Congress party , expressed her readiness to take on any responsibilities assigned by the high command, following her meeting with Congress Chief Mallikarjun Kharge . YS Sharmila's party, YSR Telangana Party, merged with the Congress, fulfilling her father's dream of seeing Rahul Gandhi become the Prime Minister of India. She praised the Congress as the largest secular party that upholds Indian culture and unites its people. Sharmila also expressed her anguish over the situation in Manipur and emphasized the need for the Congress to be in power to prevent such incidents. üëì View full article

results.title: Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist killed in encounter in J&K's Shopian
results.description: A LeT terrorist, Bilal Ahmed Bhat, was killed in an encounter with security forces in Shopian district, Jammu and Kashmir. Bhat was involved in the killing of an Army personnel, non-local labourers, and a Kashmiri Pandit. He was also responsible for instigating local youth to join terrorist ... Reported by IndiaTimes 10 minutes ago.
results.content: Friday, 5 January 2024 ( 28 minutes ago ) A LeT terrorist, Bilal Ahmed Bhat, was killed in an encounter with security forces in Shopian district, Jammu and Kashmir. Bhat was involved in the killing of an Army personnel, non-local labourers, and a Kashmiri Pandit . He was also responsible for instigating local youth to join terrorist ranks. The security forces launched a cordon and search operation in Chotigam village based on specific information. During the encounter, Bhat fired at the forces and was retaliated effectively. üëì View full article

The Prime Minister was awed by her performance and praised her on social media. Taking to X ... Reported by IndiaTimes 10 minutes ago.
results.content: Friday, 5 January 2024 ( 26 minutes ago ) Swati Mishra, a musician and singer gained sudden attention after her melodies caught the attention of Prime Minister Narendra Modi with her captivating rendition of the ‚ÄòRam Ayenge‚Äò bhajan. The Prime Minister was awed by her performance and praised her on social media. Taking to X (formerly Twitter) PM Modi shared a video of her on Wednesday and wrote, ‚ÄúThis devotional bhajan of Swati Mishra ji to welcome Shri Ram Lalla is mesmerising.‚Äù Her bhajan was taken as a way of welcoming the inauguration that is set to take place on January 22. üëì View full article

results.title: Ready, aim, fire! India-UAE Armies conduct military exercise ‚ÄòDesert Cyclone‚Äô in Rajasthan
creator: Satya Prakash
results.description: The Exercise aims to achieve shared security objectives and foster bilateral relations between two friendly nations, said a release from the Indian government.
results.content: New Delhi: The UAE Land Forces contingent comprising 45 personnel are taking part in a joint military exercise with Indian Army at Mahajan in Rajasthan. The military exercise, named as ‚ÄòDesert Cyclone‚Äô will conclude on January 15. The UAE contingent is being represented by troops from the Zayed First Brigade, while the Indian Army contingent comprising 45 personnel is being represented mainly by a Battalion from the Mechanised Infantry Regiment. The aim of the exercise is to enhance interoperability in sub-conventional operations including Fighting in Built-Up Area (FIBUA) in desert/ semi desert terrain under Chapter VII of the United Nations Charter on Peace Keeping Operations. The Exercise will enhance cooperation and interoperability between both the sides during Peace Keeping Operations. Drills planned to be rehearsed during Exercise ‚ÄòDESERT CYCLONE‚Äô include Establishment of a Joint Surveillance Centre, Cordon and Search Operation, Domination of Built-Up Area and Heliborne Operations. The Exercise will also foster collaborative partnership and help in sharing best practices between the two sides. Exercise ‚ÄòDESERT CYCLONE‚Äô signifies further strengthening of bonds of friendship and trust between India and the UAE. The Exercise aims to achieve shared security objectives and foster bilateral relations between two friendly nations, said a release from the Indian government.
